# browser(_:isColumnValid:)

**Instance Method**

Returns whether the contents of the specified column are valid.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func browser(_ sender: NSBrowser, isColumnValid column: Int) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **sender**: The browser containing the column to validate.
- **column**: The index of the column to validate.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the column’s contents are valid; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. If [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] is returned, `sender` reloads the column.

## Discussion

This method is invoked in response to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBrowser/validateVisibleColumns()]method of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBrowser] being sent to `sender`.

## Related Documentation

- **Browser Programming Topics**

## Getting Browser Information

- **browser(_:numberOfRowsInColumn:)**: Returns the number of rows of data in the specified column.
- **browser(_:numberOfChildrenOfItem:)**: Asks the delegate for the number of children the given item has.
- **browser(_:titleOfColumn:)**: Asks the delegate for the title to display above the specified column.
